title: Time const - compare Rx and Ry from Q-vs-t graph

content.question: Circuit <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, shown in the figure, have identical capacitors but different resistors and batteries. The resistances and potential differences across the batteries are as indicated. Initially, the switches are open and the capacitors are uncharged. The switches are then closed at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, after which the charges on the capacitor plates increase from zero as indicated in the graph. Which resistance value, <math alttext="R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> or <math alttext="R sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, is greater, and what evidence from the graph supports the claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> is greater. The final capacitor charge is greater for Circuit <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

<math alttext="R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> is greater. The initial slope of the graph is greater for Circuit <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

<math alttext="R sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math> is greater. The time to reach <math alttext="6 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Î¼</mi><mtext>C</mtext></math> is greater for Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

<math alttext="R sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math> is greater. The time to reach half of the final charge is greater for Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="R sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math> is greater. The time to reach half of the final charge is greater for Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
